section.title: Urxvt
section.para: Urxvt, also known as rxvt-unicode, is a highly customizable terminal emulator.

section.title: Configuring urxvt
section.para:
To get a list of all the plugins available, open the Nix REPL and run $ nix repl :l <nixpkgs> map (p: p.name) pkgs.rxvt-unicode.plugins
Alternatively, if your shell is bash or zsh and have completion enabled, simply type nixpkgs.rxvt-unicode.plugins.<tab>.

section.title: Packaging urxvt plugins
section.para: Urxvt plugins resides in pkgs/applications/misc/rxvt-unicode-plugins. To add a new plugin create an expression in a subdirectory and add the package to the set in pkgs/applications/misc/rxvt-unicode-plugins/default.nix.
A plugin can be any kind of derivation, the only requirement is that it should always install perl scripts in $out/lib/urxvt/perl. Look for existing plugins for examples.

If the plugin is itself a perl package that needs to be imported from other plugins or scripts, add the following passthrough: passthru.perlPackages = [ "self" ];
This will make the urxvt wrapper pick up the dependency and set up the perl path accordingly.
